title: Price of a hotel room in Charlotte is up how much in the past year?
text:
Enlarge Fuse The cost of a night's stay in a hotel room in Charlotte is up 6% from a year ago,… more The average price of a hotel room in Charlotte is up 6% from this time last year, according to a new report from booking website Hotels.com. The latest Hotel Price Index report , issued Wednesday, shows a night’s stay in a room in Charlotte averaged $121 during the first half of the year, up from $114 a year earlier. Although the city was solidly in the top half of the nation in terms of the percentage jump in room prices, the cost locally still ranks near the bottom among the country’s 50 most popular destinations. Nationwide, hotel-room prices were up 2% from the first half of last year, according to Hotels.com. The HPI is based on data from bookings made through Hotels.com websites worldwide, using the prices customers actually paid, including taxes and fees.
